What a shame that a really competent director like Andre de Toth who specialized in slippery, shifting alliances didn't get hold of this concept first. He could have gotten those tricky gray areas between the two sides of the main characters out on the screen and turned it into a memorable and dynamic same-era-only-invitiation battle of wits. And boy does he need this kind of project: notice how "The Gunfighter" descends into the world's most ridiculous Western.

But I doubt many were running to see this movie. Or "Some Came Running Out Of The Cinema". Okay, that's a bit harsh.
